column4: Ok! Heres a challenge for everyone! Flash disk says I/O read error when in windows and ubuntu.. when trying to format fat32 using Gparted and using fdisk from command.. running in root also .. Flash disk does not allow deletion of files/ cannot write change to delete file... Cannot copy files to the flash disk main directory.. CAN copy files to the flash disk directory 'downloads' cannot...
...delete files from the directory 'downlaods' or the main directory.  Anyone know how to fix this?
are you gettingc kernel errors?  see "dmesg" output
I can paste kernel errors in bin.
fat driver is feeling very unhappy
hewever this could of course be caused by underlying media/driver/interface fault or incompatibility
or it could just need a new fat filesystem (mkdosfs -F 32  or whatever)
the filesystem driver is panicing ... so of course you are getting higer-level errors
im getting errors on windows too
yes... if the filesystem is broken ..thats not suprising
ok so i can fix it by typing?
hrrm well look in  http://packages.ubuntu.com/  and see if you can figure out ... Note 6.06=Dapper
